availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Union County, Kentucky, attorney. Springfield, Kentucky, native. Son of John Reed and Martha Nantz Hughes. Graduated from Centre College in Danville, Kentucky, in 1852. Admitted to the bar in January 1855. Married to Wright Parker on December 18, 1855. Attorney for Hughes, Dallam & Huges law firm with Willis G. Hughes and Francis Henry Dallam.

ab.bibl: History of Union County, Kentucky: A Complete Account of the Settlement, Organization and Government of the County, Together with Facts and Figures Concerning the Society, Professions, Commerce, Industries, Agriculture, Coal, Railroads, Education, Religion, and Other Institutions and Recources of the County and Biographical Sketches of its Leading Citizens. Evansville, In: Courier Co., Printers, Binders and Engravers, 1886. 192-195. Kentucky, County Marriage Records -- 1783-1965, Madison County Courthouse, Film #000562202, Union County Marriages, p. unknown.
